column1: Carl "Nibs" Cotton was the youngest child of Tolman Cotton Senior.

column2: Carl and his siblings spent much time in Bywater
column3: and used to swim in the Bywater Pool with the Gamgee children often. He had not yet come of age when the Ruffians entered the Shire
column4: so his father ordered him to guard the house with a pitch fork while his father and brothers fought in the Battle of Bywater.

column1: Carl was probably named after his ancestor
column2: Carl (son of Cottar). The nickname "Nibs" has been a term of mock respect in historical English.Jim Allan (ed.)
